website_summaries.verdict: Google Wifi is the best Wi-Fi system on the market.
pros: Google Wifi is easy to use and a breeze to set up
It has strong Wi-Fi coverage and fast speed
It costs a lot less than other mesh Wi-Fi systems
cons: A Google account and a mobile device are required for setup and management
It doesn't have many advanced features or customizable network settings

customer_reviews.title: NOT RELIABLE - DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: DON’T BUY - mesh system is constantly going offline. I have to reboot it several times a day. I reached out to Google for support but received no response. I wish I had purchased a different mesh system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great when it first came out but if you enjoy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great when it first came out but if you enjoy using 40 to 60mbs when you are paying for 250mbs don’t buy and save your money....
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't deliver what it promised.
customer_reviews.text: I had such a difficult time with this. I would roam and reconnect to a different AP and my throughput would drop to less than 5 Mbps. Contrast that to the single AP I was attempting to replace where I can move to the farthest point in my house and still see about 50 Mbps. There was no logical explanation for this behavior with the Google devices so I returned them, though I am so dissappointed this didn't work out..
customer_reviews.author: Joe A

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: So after setup get a message saying even though you did everything right that google wifi cant connect to modem and to call your internet service provider. After three attempts with same results, back to using old router.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Keep losing connection between the 3 devices
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I've got my 3 devices 30 feet from each other and when testing the mesh I get poor results and connection. Streaming hangs and internet drop all the time.
customer_reviews.author: MAXIMILIANO M VALLARO

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to install and now I never lose wifi in my house. It blends in great .
customer_reviews.author: Patrick MontoyaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: 2 of of 3 units dead in less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in June of this year, I don’t know what happened exactly but this weekend one of the power cords looks like it caught on fire on one unit. Another unit looks in great shape but when plugged in nothing happens anymore, not even the blue light.
customer_reviews.author: JTKTPlus

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with AT&T WiFi Calling.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to “cheap out” and get the Google WiFi system instead of Eero. Ended up returning the Google WiFi units for Eero. If you want WiFi Calling on your cellphone, be aware that Google WiFi doesn’t work- I found this out after installing. I guess this is a known issue... I just wasted my time before discovering it. Skip it and go with Eero. Installed it today and it is awesome. Easy setup and WiFi Calling is all go! The Eero app is a lot less clunky and way more intuitive than the Google WiFi app.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a week.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as a router replacement, but after a week it stopped working. We had to attempt to reinstall from scratch, but it never moved past the saving configuration stage even after several hours. Amazon also won't let you return this item, so be very cautious. We had to get a charge back from our credit card company.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lutterloh

customer_reviews.title: Horrible CS response. 3 weeks and still they have not resolved the issue.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a month and I have been trying to get an issue resolved for over 3 weeks. They are completely unresponsive. Have spent at least 4 hours on the phone with tech support and multiple emails. Still my app does not work. I got this so I could control when my kids get on the internet but it is useless if the app doesn't work. Extremely disappointed as I thought buying something from Google would mean a higher level of services. It is the exact opposite. It is like they can't do anything and don't care because they are google. I have sent emails to the trouble ticket email many times with no response.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Tripp (renee@usamktg.com)

customer_reviews.title: Great AP if Connected to AC1900
customer_reviews.text: If you're researching the best option for a mesh Wi-Fi for larger homes, you clearly see the advantages with this system. What I did was slightly different than buying the 3-pack. I bought the larger Google TP-Link AC1900 (black) access point, and added 1 of these Google hockey puck access points to the aforementioned AC1900 access point. That gave me the same area coverage and it saved me $50. So in short, I have 1 big AC1900 AP and 1 white hockey puck AP. The OnHub app allows you to set them both up to create a larger ubiquitous Wi-Fi network in your home. I would recommend this to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Nur Ali

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: This product stinks. I read a view reviews before buying and they praised it. If I had read further I would have discovered a serious problem: many ipad users find this systems keeps dropping connectivity. You have to keep turning wifi off and then on to reconnect. It seems to affect a good number of ipads but not enough for Google to fix the problem yet. I am so tired of losing wifi on the ipad (not a problem on my PC) that I am throwing this piece of junk in the garbage where it belongs just as soon as my new non-Google internet router arrives. This problem has been doing on for some time, why hasn't Google fixed it?!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago guy

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for 6 months then suddenly stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for 6 months then suddenly stopped working. After hours of tech support we fixed it with no real explanation as for why it went offline in the first place. Worked great for another 3 months and now having the same issue. Several hours of "troubleshooting" have not resolved the issues. I'll be switching to the eero in hopes that it's a better product.
customer_reviews.author: jz

customer_reviews.title: If thinking wired, avoid
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking using this devices as a mesh using a wired network avoid it like the plague. As of this writing, Nov 21 2019, there has a been an issue for a year where this devices will create havoc in your network and will bring it down with a spanning tree / ARP storm. If you experiment lagging, drops of connections, Chromecast disconnects, slow downs, even on wired equipment, these devices are the cause. Look for thread 191256 in Google Support forums, then you will see the horde of people complaining without Google caring at all.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos J.

customer_reviews.title: What an Excellent Mesh system.
customer_reviews.text: WiFi was always a pain to get coverage in my home. I purchased a D-Link router and it did not cover all the rooms and seemed to be limited to about 50 connections. When the Google WiFi 3-pack went on sale I bought and now I wished I'd bought much earlier! Thirty minutes of setup. Simply plug the first one into the Modem and boot your HOME APP program on your phone. Hit the ADD button and let it do its thing. Follow the easy on -screen directions. So simple and now I have coverage all over. I can expand the system later to cover the outdoor spaces too!
customer_reviews.author: TexasKid747

customer_reviews.title: What an Amazing Improvement!
customer_reviews.text: If you have UVerse do yourself a favor and order this product right now. When it arrives, type 192.168.1.254 into the address bar of your browser. Manage your UVerse router and turn off all wi-fi signals. Plug this device into the back of your Uverse router with a network cable. Put the Google Wifi app on a device of your choosing, and configure the Google Wifi Enjoy! So much better. So much faster. Wayyyyy better signal strength. I only have one of these and it easily covers 5000sq/ft of my house. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: IAMSLICK

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: terribly slow in certain area and range is not nearly as wide as claimed
customer_reviews.author: Golden Bear

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, no ability to between 5/2 gz, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Unstable, no ability to between 5/2 gz, and it considers 70mb “lightening fast” which is laughable when you’re paying for (and getting close to with other routers) 300 mb.
customer_reviews.author: Excali

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it's ok For the non-secure crowd
customer_reviews.text: Keeping this short and sweet. Over time the performance of this mesh just drags further and further down. The security is extremely lacking. The mesh setup is nice and easy. The whole system is designed for those who are clueless about securing their personal data, protecting their home network, or those who just don't care if they broadcast their private and personal data to any and all. Google sniffs your personal data, requires you to dumb down your network and doesn't work well with smart devices or various phone apps. Performance is sluggish and the main pod just gets overworked. Update: the pause of internet is flaky and works 1 out of 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Brimhall

customer_reviews.title: GOOGLE HOME WiFi FAILS - Drops 3-4 times a day.
customer_reviews.text: GOOGLE Router worked well for the first year with an occasional loss of signal. A year later, it now goes down 3-4 times a night making it impossible to watch a movie or play a game without resetting the router. Multiple users post reviews with the same complaint. No one knows why. What are you going to do for your customers GOOGLE! On how to fix the issue. Or is this $300 router only good for 2 years! I should purchased from COSTCO ... at least they protect the customer by taking it back. We now are looking for a new system for a router.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, it's just a bit older technology now.  Do not use these on complex networks.
customer_reviews.text: These are the right choice if you're expanding an existing Google WiFi mesh but otherwise I'd look for something newer that supports 802.11ax. The reliability on these is decent, and they are fairly painless to set up. Performance is good with ethernet backhaul but only ok with wireless backhaul. I should warn though that these things are a disaster on complex networks with ethernet backhaul. Google's solution to how they mesh is to generate huge amounts of STP traffic, so backhauled to a single dumb switch they are fine but connect them up to anything more complicated or that understands STP and these can cause all kinds of weirdness with switching loops etc.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This really sucks, don’t but it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for home, one for work, on October 15th of last year. On September 20 of this year the home one died and in September 29th the work one died. Not even one year life span? I just returned from the computer store and bought two replacements and the guy there said they had almost twenty brands but Google is the ONLY brand that he doesn’t recommend to anyone. So, this pretty much sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Sigel

customer_reviews.title: Very good WiFi coverage
customer_reviews.text: Very good WiFi coverage. Super nice and sleek design. The setup took me less than 15 minutes. It just skyrocketed my WiFi speed. I Love that I can monitor all devices from my phone connected to my network, test the network in a blink and move around without switch SSID. The set up in my house is 3 levels and I have strong WiFi everywhere. The only downside is the limitation on ethernet ports. Each mesh has one ethernet port available only so if you need to extend a wire connection to more than one device you might need an ethernet switch.
customer_reviews.author: P.L

customer_reviews.title: Glad I finally have good WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Previously I only had a choice between att and cox. Both seem to raise their price every time you sneeze. Took out att and never worked right. Would lose signal to my tvs and didn’t work well on my balcony. I only have 900 square feet. Google WiFi just became available and I took it out. Cost a little bit more but make up for it when we’re home in the winter. Just call and cancel it. Att charged us $7 a month when we didn’t use it for 7 months. The router works great. No loss of signal. Really easy to set up. Google has a great app for this. Extremely happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Judge

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.. its a fraud ! I want my money back ...
customer_reviews.text: Dear Friends at Amazon. As a long term AMAZON PRIME USER expending a bunch of $$ in different products ....I want to let you know guys that I'm totally disappointed with this product. Performance its very bad, follow the steps to set the app its easy but devices connected to it perform BAD and even at lower performance and under other more cheap ane easy to set gateways/wan routers like the one provided by Xfinity. Expensive and bad product. Don't use this hardware. I want my money back !!!! i WANT MY MONEY BACK. TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: They need to fix the problems with AT&T WiFi Calling
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 access points and the wifi is great, hand off as I walk around works every time. I have one problem, I use AT&T and the Wifi Calling is terrible, actually unusable and very disappointing, It is apparently a known issue (see Google Product Forums) and I would switch to another mesh option, but I am stuck with this investment. I have had to buy a ATT Microcell, as the cell service at my house is so poor.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewM

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Airport Extreme.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my Apple Airport Extreme and I only wish I had done this sooner. Setup is painless (it really is as easy as everyone mentions) and I had all three access points working in less than 10 minutes. The coverage is much improved and so are the speeds. With the Airport Extreme I had a few areas in the house that had very weak signal. I have over 20 wifi devices connected and have had zero issues. The google app for iphone is also well done and I like being able to see the network status and test the upload/download speeds. HIghly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hockeycrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Connectivity, Security Lacking
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job getting WiFi in and around our house, so that I can extend our wireless connectivity to our garage. The Good: -Easy setup -Great connectivity The Bad: -Only has a mobile interface; these could really benefit from a local network web interface so that they could be controlled from a computer as well -Security is a bit lacking; you can't just outright lock out devices that connect, so if someone has your WiFi password and you don't want them on your network you cannot block out their devices. Instead, MAC filtering only allows you to block Internet access, but the devices still connect to your local network.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Covalt

customer_reviews.title: You really can't go wrong.. excellent range and reliability!
customer_reviews.text: I do own a tech company but also buy/install routers for friends and family. I've installed well over 200 of these. I'm not joking and there have been 0 issues. The range is easily up to 4 times what you get for similarly priced single routers. That has a guest mode and gigabit LAN. Only one port but that's enough for most people these days. Also compatible with the new nest version however you need one of these as the primary in order to mix them together. They update themselves and install with an app that has surprisingly useful features. I'd highly recommend these for home and some small office/business use.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Edwards - HPC

customer_reviews.title: why does this claim to be better than a $20 network extender?
customer_reviews.text: this is actually a pain in the ass to set up. on the same screen it says “network offline” and “all set up! you’re good to go!” so which one is it??? devices need to be realllly close together to “mesh” but isn’t the whole point to cover your home area? i wasn’t planning on buying more than 3 of these pieces of s***! if i need one every 10 feet then they fail to do anything. the app has lots of cutesy poo graphics but it still sucks. RETURN.
customer_reviews.author: bhb

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until Google broke it. Drops Internet constantly.
customer_reviews.text: This is a known problem that many, many users have reported over the past several months and Google still hasn't fixed it. Our issues began a week ago, completely out of the blue, after roughly a year of use with no problems. Nothing was changed about our network - Google Wifi just suddenly started dropping connection to the Internet multiple times a day, requiring a hard power cycle to resolve. Search the web for this issue before you buy. I was previously a big fan of these, but they are becoming completely unusable for my business. We will be forced to buy Orbi or another mesh product and hope for better results.
customer_reviews.author: NickSaban

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea why our internet was so slow, then a tech came out and told us that our router was outdated, so the high speed service we were paying for couldn't be accessed. Our son told us about this type of router, so we ordered this particular brand because we are familiar with google products. We couldn't be happier. We have no other routers to compare it with, but we have no complaints with this one. The speed is fantastic...no more "circling the wagons"! Even with walls and mirrors between the 3 routers, the signal miraculously reaches the computer...love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: This mesh network is incredibly hard to troubleshoot. The settings are nonexistent because the product “takes care of it for you” aka you can’t fix actually problems. Ironically I’m having the most problems with google WiFi other devices in the Google ecosystem. None of my fire tv sticks or Chromecast were available to cast to so I rebooted the WiFi. Now I can see my fire tv sticks but my google home and Chromecast still can’t connect to my WiFi. My Echo devices were never impacted. Tech support appears to have been cut off during the pandemic. I once waited hours because my google WiFi wasn’t working with my new modem; no one ever connected to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Catarina

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls don’t work, Google phasing this product out
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a 5 star product. But if you want parental controls and continued support, then you do not want this product. The parental controls on our Google wifi just completely stopped working. The schedule that had been setup and working for 2 years showed it was on, but all of the devices on the list were still able to access the internet. Google wants you to buy the v2 of this product (which is supposed to have an awful UI experience via the Google Home app), and seems to have forgotten about this once fine product.
customer_reviews.author: wolverine1995

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, and doesn't work with AT&T Wifi calling, texting, etc
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mesh network to deal with the fact that my home just barely falls into an AT&T dead zone. Well, guess what? This is the only router that doesn't work with AT&T Wifi. It says it works. Sometimes it even does work. But 90% of the time, calls and texts just don't come in. Google and AT&T have known about this for over a year, and neither has done anything about it. So if you have AT&T, I can't recommend using the Google Wifi mesh network at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mesh WiFi network in every corner of our house
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier with my purchase. We have a 2 story 3,000 sq ft house and WiFi was extremely spotty using only the ATT Uverse gateway router. So we added some wired old routers in access point mode and that was better but we still had to have multiple networks, so we lost bandwidth and signal strength. The Google WiFi pucks were ridiculously easy to set up with the iPhone app and our WiFi strength is now at its max strength in every corner of the house. That’s a game changer even without the added features the app provides like network insights and managing individual users data use.
customer_reviews.author: Fndjx

customer_reviews.title: If WiFi signal is more important than speed then this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.text: As an IT professional and after installing this in my home I can not recommend this product. Sure it gets wifi to every part of your home but I get 300 Mbps down in my home and this product cuts that down to 130 at the second AP location 15' away. At the third it's down to 80 Mbps an additional 20' from the second AP location. Google support is unable to figure out what is going on with no solution in sight. If WiFi signal is more important than speed then this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and my iphones, ipads liked the Wifi. MacBook and iMac were kinda of ok on the network. My printers and ecobee couldn’t see the new Wifi system. I spent hours, including a phone call to google and a connection to Epson and a new printer Dropped call and no fix. I returned it to Amazon today and turned my Apple Wifi system back on. Shopping for something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Fun guy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing performance and setup interface
customer_reviews.text: Update: I gave up and will return it. It is just too unreliable, no improvement over 8 year old hardware and having to use my phone to manage is frustrating. Old review: I thought that replacing my 8 year old Asus router with the google mesh wifi would be an improvement, but it turns out to be a huge disappointment. I noticed absolutely no performance increase, which going from N to AC should bring. The app you have to use is ok, but there aren't many settings, it has about 20% off the Asus routers features. This is not a power user router replacement. It probably is good for non technical people, I am not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fast install router.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing system. Set up while Netflix was on pause, took out old router, put in Google Mesh. TV didn’t loose a tick. Picked up right on with show, no pauses or buffering. Downloaded software update on router, while watching same show. Again no buffering or pauses. TV runs on Wi-Fi. This is an awesome, incredibly easy, fast install. Great App on phone to install. Completed in 15 minutes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: N0RRR

customer_reviews.title: WIFI signal is good only in clear view
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router with high hopes that it will provide great signal throughout the apartment, when there is no obstruction - it provides great full ISP speeds but just behind small 1 inch wood panel from my drawer and speeds are very slow and almost no signal on speedtest. Another biggest dissapointment is so called parental control - I thought it would block individual websites like youtube, etc.. and won't limit overall access to internet since these days all homework is online only but hey, it doesn't block individual websites. This one goes back.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Settler

customer_reviews.title: Easy WiFi setup
customer_reviews.text: It was a snap to set up this 3-Pack Google WiFi system. Instructions on the app are simple and easy to follow. I had whole-house WiFi at excellent strength levels throughout. Setting up my devices (computers, phones, streaming sticks) and getting onto the internet was not so easy, but eventually everything got connected. Google product support is excellent and helped this non-techi with device installations. They gave me all the time I needed and were very patient. After all was set up and working smoothly they were happy and offered to buy me a beer. YIPPEE!
customer_reviews.author: Tourpro

customer_reviews.title: good but..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for ease of use. Changed to Spectrum Internet and I wanted a wifi router. I have a 1500sq ft house, two floors and the only issue I have is if I get 40 ft away it disconnects me. Don't know if its the router or my signal or interference. I'm going to see if this gets better or if I can remedy without the purchase of another extender. I'll update. Otherwise it's great, so easy to set up and use your iPhone and I really like the "guest" wifi option.
customer_reviews.author: Giant Malamute

customer_reviews.title: No significant improvement
customer_reviews.text: Since 'cutting the cord', I have been 100% streaming and my service provider has even up'ed my Megs to 200. However, I still get buffering freezes lasting @ 5 seconds. A little and a lot irritating when watching or binging my favorite Amazon, Netflix or Hulu original content. I have a compact 1 BR apartment with my router 8' off the floor and open. So. purchased the Google Wifi system to hopefully solve the 5 second dilemma. Nope...Honestly, I tried in a multiple of configurations/placements. I even asked "OK Google" for advice. "If your wifi isn't working, tap, more info on how to fix." RIGHT!!
customer_reviews.author: Terence Lowery

customer_reviews.title: The wifi router that gets worse over time.....
customer_reviews.text: I have had google wifi for a few years now and the experience has done nothing but get worse and worse. Constant device disconnects where I have to turn off wifi and turn it back on. My Chromecast loses its connection completely at least twice a day to the point where I have to unplug it. DO NOT BUY GOOGLE WIFI!!!
customer_reviews.author: DanM

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Easy to setup. We are in a 100 year old , 2000 square foot home with plaster walls, the router is in the basement. The Google WiFi can handle four people on zoom calls at the same time, in opposite ends of the house, without dropping!
customer_reviews.author: Mania

customer_reviews.title: The best WiFi money can buy
customer_reviews.text: We previously had] and a router that Verizon was claimed was fast enough for their gigabit FIOs service. Both had issues reaching certain parts of my 2,200 sq ft house. Google WiFi has none of those problems. Connectivity is consistent enough that I do not have to think about it. The app is also miles ahead of what I am used to when it comes to managing wifi. I am still able to use my Apple Time Capsule for backups by connecting it to one of the wifi devices. I also am able to connect myto the Google wifi device closest to my office, and since then I have had much better phone reception. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Kris B

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR FIOS  customers with Internet AND FIOS TV service.
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with Verizon or Frontier FIOS IF you also have their TV Service. Google Wi-Fi insists on being the router and FIOS TV only works correctly if their router is the primary router. Huge conflicts occur is both are used together. This should be more prominently listed. (At least I missed it and wasted a Sunday afternoon in frustration. If I ever actually cut the cable or go to another provider, I'd buy this again in a heartbeat. Pleasant surprise. Google tech support is great very quick to answer and very thorough.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this Mesh Router, experienced numerous firmware issues (i.e. lowered speed/disconnection) and customer service only gives canned responses. AVOID!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nhan

customer_reviews.title: wifi is great. Boiled down to my cell phone having an ...
customer_reviews.text: Had some major issue for the first few months, troubleshooting back and forth with Google (great tech support by the way) Constant wifi dropping, After getting upset with my ISP, we found it was not my internet provider, but Google home, mini and chrome cast were the issue. If those devices were unplugged, wifi is great. Boiled down to my cell phone having an old version of google play. But now works great. Still kinda slow compared to my older ASUS router, but I have so much more control with these pucks.
customer_reviews.author: Libs101

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 worked
customer_reviews.text: My cable company technician recommended this "easy to install" router pack. It arrived in a professionally packaged box, but with no installation instructions or owner's manual of any sort. I went on-line for installation help and struggled to understand instructions, since I am not a "techie". After downloading Google Wi-fi app and setting up Google wi-fi network (1 hr), I installed first of three routers. It worked! Set up second router; no success. Called seller, who spent an hour on phone talking me through installation. Still didn't work. Installed third router and it worked. Seller sent return label, and second router is en route back to seller for replacement. Working routers are fine.
customer_reviews.author: wallachio

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product. It has increased the speed of my wi-fi to all my devices. With the whole family connected we have never experienced any issues. It was easy to install. The instructions were clear. There is an app that can be downloaded to your phone. The product was suggested by a friend and I thought let’s give it a try couldn’t hurt. I love it. Ran speed tests on my laptop and iPhone. Upload speeds in the 200’s and download speeds near 300. Great improvement from before for all you tech savvy people. I would recommend because it really gives you better Wi-fi coverage in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Namiko Howard

customer_reviews.title: A must for full WiFi Coverage - Best value for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: These devices give you the WiFi coverage that you require for any network, they can be used as an access point or a router, the pack of there was the best option since I have a Goole Hub for my router which integrated with the three access point very easily and they update themselves and monitor themselves. Every corner of my house now has GREAT WiFi signal. This is a must if you are attempting any type of home automation such as Alexa, Google Home, Ring, Arlo, etc. - the WiFi coverage is usually the weakest link in everyone's attempt to use wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: whpooh

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated After Failed Setup
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our aging router and ended up returning it immediately. Set up was supposed to be easy and near flawless, but unfortunately, even though it was plugged directly into our internet, at the end it couldn't "find" the signal. Because the set up has zero access to any other settings, even tech support couldn't figure out what the problem was. It also didn't allow for us to pass-through our internet directly to more than one other item. Usually, we prefer to run a wired connection to all three parts of our entertainment system. We were willing to take a chance on wifi-only, but since the unit could never find the internet, that never became an option.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. McCandless

customer_reviews.title: Probably overpaid for just the name
customer_reviews.text: I was paying for a 250 mbs fiber connection but in reality was only getting about 40 mbs on my devices. Decided to buy the Google Wi-Fi to take advantage of the faster speed. My speeds improved (70 mbs) but not that much. The user interface is all done with an app. It's just OK and probably fine for most people but does not have the granular options that you might get from a typical Wi-Fi router/access point.
customer_reviews.author: Dana S

customer_reviews.title: 200Mbs speeds on wifi!! Best router BY FAR!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a modem/router so easy to use, a 9 year old could configure it. Works PERFECT with Century Link Gigabit internet. Wifi speeds of nearly 200Mbs down AND up all over the house **with 25 devices connected AND 3 HD wifi surveillance cameras running** Full disclosure: Home is 6,000 sq ft so I purchased two (6 access points total) right out of the gate. I've struggled with fast wifi for years purchasing the latest "state of the art" routers from Asus and Netgear every 2 years. Always had issues with my cameras, VOIP phones, etc. Leave it to Google to come along and SMOKE the industry leading routers! Couldn't be happier and yep, I'm telling EVERYBODY about this product! :)
customer_reviews.author: Donald Bakewell

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and strong signal throughout my home!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to installing the Google Wi-Fi system I was utilizing the Router provided by Spectrum. A brand new router, supposedly their best ever but the wi-fi signal was even weaker than my previous Spectrum wi-fi. I installed the 3 pack in various parts of my 2000 sq foot home and now have a strong signal in all locations, even my garage. The installation was relatively easy but I did stumble. I called and spoke with a Google rep who very patiently walked me through the process which took about 10 minutes. Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.author: TCarew

customer_reviews.title: Cool Feature
customer_reviews.text: I have the Google WIFI System for a while and it did clear all of the dead WIFI spots in my house. Even reaching a detached garage that has a WIFI garage door and WIFI irrigation system. I have about 40 internet devices in my house. Yesterday I switched to fiber internet service. I was thinking I would have to go to each device, provide the new router name and password ugh. But when I plugged in the Google WIFI System to the new modem and all devices worked, the devices are linked to the Google system not the internet provided router. In seconds we had completely moved over to the new router. I thought this was an added benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Yup.  Just yes for extending mesh WIFI further
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the newer NEST devices, the additional points can all be connected via ethernet using a switch. THIS makes these superior for extending mesh WIFI further, even if they don't have the latest WIFI tech. For my purposes where the router being at the central hub of a WIFI-only mesh setup is not practical, the ethernet feature trumps the newer WIFI tech.
customer_reviews.author: David Bell

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Verizon Fios
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to extend the wifi range of our condo. It's not a big condo, but our Verizon Gateway router is on one end of the condo and the bedrooms are on the other. Using the internet in the bedrooms was a pain in the butt until I installed these around the house! To install these, you will need to first go in to the router page and turn off the wireless signal coming from the router itself, then just follow the prompt from Google Wifi app on your phone. Installation was effortless. Now we have fast internet everywhere in the house! This is a cheap alternative to the wifi extender from Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Lee

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had known about this sooner
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing technology. I replaced my Hotwire router and 2 inadequate Linksys extenders with a three piece Google Mesh Wifi system. It was as easy to set up as taking a phone photo. It all works through a mobile app (not your PC) covers more area, more efficiently. If you have any dead or weak spots in your house, where your streaming TV continues to lose signal and "spin", this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi router
customer_reviews.text: We already had three but just built a detached inlaw apt and needed another boost to avoid having to pay for separate internet. This worked perfectly, the main house is almost 5,000 sq ft and the inlaw about 900 sq ft and this was the extra boost we needed to support the many many electronic devices being used all day. We’ve had these products for about two years and no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Lilconn

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life....seriously
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This thing has literally changed my life. It completely embarrassed my older Apple airport express. I use to struggle with internet even when I was by my router. Now I get it everywhere in our home (3,000 square feet) and on our back porch, our front porch, our driveway, and even by our mailbox outside! I can now waste time scrolling through instagram while checking my mail without wasting data. But in all seriousness, this really is a great setup, and it's super simple to initiate. The app walks you through setup and even tests the speeds for you. The app interface is user friendly and makes making changes a breeze. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: I know the headline seems overly dramatic but it's true. My office is on the lower level and I never had decent wifi. I couldn't even take a Facetime call from my office - I had to go upstairs. Even after I installed just 2 of the 3 boxes, I had 4 bars (circles?)... then I installed the 3rd and now I have instant, strong, reliable service. These are amazing. I had trouble installing the 3rd box so I called their customer service, and in 10 min, he walked me through how to fix it. Also amazing. THANK YOU GOOGLE!
customer_reviews.author: steephill

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: This router has a clean and Apple-like form factor including the boxing. Setup is about as easy and intuitive as it could be. Setup does require a Google account. Price is reasonable and additional units can be used for more coverage. There is only one Ethernet port, so you will have to use an Ethernet switch if you need more. Following the demise of my previous router, I found this router to be an excellent replacement. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic WiFi mesh system
customer_reviews.text: I'm really satisfied with the Google WiFi mesh system. We only have a 1500 sq. ft. home but I got 3 any way because the main unit is downstairs and the 2nd is on the next floor of our Raised Ranch. We have a long hallway to the bedrooms that we never had a good WiFi signal in, even with a good router and an access point / extender. Now we do. We get an incredible signal even with the doors shut. The setup was very easy. A recent update added a lot of features too. Glad I finally got this.
customer_reviews.author: Ezrway

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Most wireless mesh products degrade and get weaker the farther away you are from the first WiFi Item. My son plays online games on the 3rd and final access point/repeater and he has 95% of the same speed as I get on the ethernet hardwired in. These are great for speed and simplicity. The only con is, they are too simple. Google does not give you any granular controls such as white lists, black lists, use limits, and nice reports. You have a basic dashboard on your phone with limited reporting and controls. It is OK and easy to setup. Again great speed, but needs more parental and administrative functions.
customer_reviews.author: Technology Instructor

customer_reviews.title: Solved our problem!
customer_reviews.text: We have a three-level house and the modem/router is in a closet in the basement. We have never been able to do things like streaming on the tv and our internet access through the house was hit or miss. Basically I've been paying the cable company for terrible WiFi for years but never knew how to solve it. We tried using WiFi extenders, but they never worked. Finally, a service technician suggested the Google system and it appears to have worked perfectly. Now we have a strong signal throughout the house. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TBone

customer_reviews.title: not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: i bought this product to replace 2 routers in this old home with dead zones, hoping this would boost the main router so i could remove the supplemental router used in the basement. It does not work as advertised. The systems cant be more than 2 rooms away from each other or the signal is weak. The Basement remained a deadzone requiring its own router. In addition, installing google wifi knocked the sonos sound system off my router and I was unable to reconnect these. May work well in more recently constructed homes but a giant fail here.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Huge Improvement over Netgear
customer_reviews.text: I went through so many headaches with my Netgear routers. They weren't cheap and they were supposedly top of the line but my last two from them continually dropped WiFi no matter how man times I rebooted or reset the system. Finally I decided I'd had enough and tried this setup, and as soon as I replaced the Netgear with Google, using the exact same modem and ISP, all my dropped connections instantly went away and the internet is working flawlessly ever since. I will never go back to Netgear after discovering a far superior product. Just wish I would have done more research and found this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Reilloc

customer_reviews.title: Idk how we managed without them.
customer_reviews.text: We live in a rural area with one extremely poor internet option. We have 4 extenders and successfully push WiFi from one end to the other of our 2500+sq ft tri level home. We power 5 outdoor cameras, light switches, outlets, thermostat, 3 appliances, multiple Alexa devices and have 2 adults & 2 kids with laptops, phones, tablets, video games, etc. Before the extenders, we had satellite internet to try to balance the load and get better signals. It was terrible. We spent less than $400, eliminated a $100 monthly bill and have zero problems now.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great system, even for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I was using a regular Netgear router but was not getting signal throughout my home. After researching all the options available to me I decided to give the Google mesh a try, and I am glad I did! This is my 5th point purchased and the signal across my home is fantastic. I have several home automation devices installed and it is not rare to see 30+ devices connected to the network. I have a 400Mbps wired connection and I am getting around 250Mbps on wireless so my gaming is not affected either! Technical support is fantastic and they are very helpful. Hard to understand sometimes as I believe they use overseas call centers, but that doesn't bother me :)
customer_reviews.author: V. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast connection!
customer_reviews.text: I’m no expert when it comes to internet. But this has saved us so much frustration! We have at&t wireless internet at our home and your devices would constantly freeze or take forever to load anything! I bought the three pack of routers because we have a larger home with a lot of people connecting to WiFi. After installing I have never gotten a single loading or frozen screen, everything loads with lightning speed. The setup was simple to follow and the app is very user friendly. 10/10 would recommend. Not to mention I ordered and it arrived the next day, everything about this is fast! lol
customer_reviews.author: Colie828

customer_reviews.title: Why did it take so long Google for you guys to come out with this!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Really WOW! The performance of these things blew me away. We had a Motorola modem+router setup (Arris Surfboard), and were having horrible wifi dropping issues. Installed these and not only do we now have great wifi throughout the house (3 level house with full basement), the dropping issues have completely gone away as well! Was having terrible FireTV stick wifi drop issues that have disappeared as well. Getting 175 mbps download! Never had seen that number before on a speediest in my house prior to this!!! I'm really happy I bought these as opposed to Netgear Orbi, based on the prior reviews. Trying to return the favor forward. Buy these, and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rajeev S

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Great buy. My two story home was having problems with WiFi throughout the home. I can truly say that our problems have been solved. Google wifi is top of the line. 1 device is enough for my home. We use to buffer a lot, but no more. Set up was very easy and I like being able to monitor from my phone. I can set priority devices to get the most transmission therefore my TVs get more transmission. I have been cable free for 3 years now and buffering was an issue. Not anymore. This is a good buy for those who stream.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problems
customer_reviews.text: The system isn't cheap but it's worth it. My wifi speeds close to the main unit are almost as fast as my wired speeds. Most impressive, though, is this Speedtest that I ran at the far end of my home where I had previously received such a weak signal that my phone switched to my data plan. This took minutes to set up and exceeded my expectations with regards to speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jlucas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We have an old, long, townhouse. Our extender was not that effective, so I thought this would help get rid of the wifi 'deadzones' as heavily advertised by this product. There are 3 hubs. I installed one at the main router, one upstairs, and one in the furthest bedroom (my home office). Our house is about 2,600sf. When I went through the setup app, it kept telling me to 'move the units closer to base'. They only worked as advertised when there were NO WALLS between them. Great if you live in a giant open space, but not if you have walls, not so great. The image here is from my home office computer. Pathetic. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Linette

customer_reviews.title: No WAN = No LAN
customer_reviews.text: Power & Comcast went out, fired up the generator. Sweet, I'll watch a show on my home media server... Nope! With this Google WiFi you will not get any LAN if you do not have WAN! WTF?
customer_reviews.author: pbjohnson

customer_reviews.title: Come on Google
customer_reviews.text: Signal is great as long as you’re standing on top of this thing. And it’s a pretty sturdy device lol but honestly my signal strength is significantly worse from my ATT uverse combo modem/router box. I have a 1600 Sq ft one level house. Box is in my office which is 15 yards from my bedroom. I can literally see my office door from my bedroom but my signal diff is 250mb/s to 1mb/s and constant dropping of signal. Come on Google! Do better. Hate that I’m going to have to fork out another 100-150 dollars to get another one of these wifi points to Accommodate my 1600 sq ft house. Blah
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Lightening fast!
customer_reviews.text: Had a Linksys to cover a big area. Box got very hot and burnt out the 2.4Ghz transmitter. Left only 5Ghz with bad coverage. So bought this 3 unit google Wifi. Easy to setup, just follow the highly useable app. Good coverage, and extremely high throughput. Since each unit covers a small area, saves transmission power on the access point side, and the phone side. All 3 units are cool to the touch. Very happy with the system performance and usability. The only concern is that many basic functions, eg, list of devices, require signing up to the cloud service, and forced to share the usage data with google. This sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Mstr_K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wifi router choice for large or multistory home or small business
customer_reviews.text: So far results have been excellent. I have a tri level house where coverage has always been an issue, even using a repeater. The mesh technology obsoletes earlier wifi router technology. Now i have full coverage and speed has been excellent at all locations. I have 120mbps internet service and getvfull speed servicevatvall 3 locations. I have connected HD video DVRs at eack of the 3 locations and can share files with the other 2 locations. Setup and management via my smartphone is very convenient. I recommend this product to anyone setting up a home system or a small business system. Providing guest access is very easy, keeping your own devices secure.
customer_reviews.author: Private Investor

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable!  Pretty easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I do computer consulting for homes and small businesses. I have installed around a dozen of these systems (the largest with 6 modules) and have never had an issue with any of them! They are great for replacing the router side of the Comcast modem/router box. The Comcast modem provides the high speed Internet, and the Google WiFi provides great WiFi coverage throughout the home/small business!
customer_reviews.author: Jim T

customer_reviews.title: It works so good, it feels like magic.
customer_reviews.text: It's so super simple to set this 3-pack up. I can't believe how quickly I was up and running and how good the signal is on all three floors of my house. I also love the customization I have over the kids' devices in the house. I now can easily shut off Fortnite at 7pm every night if I want. Or enable/disable a device remotely--even from another country. I also love that Google wifi does a daily speed test to check the connectivity with my ISP and also among the different access points to ensure that the network is running smoothly at all times. It feels like magic, it really does.
customer_reviews.author: Paul O

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage, no VPN interruption
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few higher power, greater coverage WIFI systems, but I always get occasional VOIP voice interruptions, or VPN disconnects. With this WIFI, we have 3 people working from home, all VPN'ed into work network with no interruption in video conferencing or VPN (virtual private network) connections. I am glad that I got this before the Covid-19 pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love them
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to set up and do exactly what they say, provide internet service into every nook of your house or apartment. I am disappointment they got rid of the original to add bells and whistles to them that are not needed for most people.
customer_reviews.author: M Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Why Fi?
customer_reviews.text: The thing kinda sorta works. My Google Fiber...and now my Google Wifi have never given me close to the speeds that I pay for. If Ethernet tethered devices are relatively slow, Wifi ones are (much) slower. They will give you between 10% and 20% of the speed that you've contracted for, if my experience is any guide.
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Great system if you don't require 2.4 ghz to connect
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for several months and love this system with one exception. It is easy to set up, has great coverage and is perfectly stable. The one thing I dislike is how it handles the band it uses - 2.4 or 5 ghz. It chooses the band and you have no ability to change it. My system almost always chooses 5 ghz which is great until you want to connect devices that can only use 2.4 ghz to connect e.g. most smart plugs. I have tried several workarounds such as moving the device far away to trick it into using the 2.4 ghz band - all without success. Still, I recommend this system and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great with FiOS
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for few days and my speeds are so much better than what I had with the Verizon FiOS provided router. I have the 100/100 plan and I'm now actually getting slightly above those numbers. Set up was very easy, the only trouble I had was connecting it to my Nest doorbell (it did connect after quite a few attempts), but apparently that's a common problem. If you have just FiOS internet and you want to replace the router they provide you with, all you need is this router, no additional equipment (modems, etc.). I'd highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Aiyana

customer_reviews.title: 1yr review. Such a let down.
customer_reviews.text: When it works it is great. But I have to reset the thing all the time. Google does a firmware update and can hide your entire network. I have spent soooooo much time managing the network it is ridiculous. The pods will just disconnect randomly or my favorite is when they go from having a strong signal to weak without anything changing for weeks, then you have to reset everything to get them working again. No it is blocking just my son's cell phone and my Dish box. Arg... Wish I would have purchased anything else .
customer_reviews.author: Todd Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from Apple Airport Extreme
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of game streaming with GeForce Now and Steam in home streaming. Our Apple Airport Extreme was also AC1200, but wow is Google better. Streaming is smooth with almost no "wifi stuttering." No more insufficient bandwidth warnings in GeForce Now. Thoughts: * I just bought the one unit and it covers our small house just fine. * The app is also really good once you get used to it. * "Pause" isn't perfect. It blocks YouTube on the iPad instantly but not our Wyze Cams at all. * The app only picks up hostnames for Apple devices (bonjour, probably), but you can manually name them.
customer_reviews.author: JPD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing at best.
customer_reviews.text: Signal is great, the interface is a bit difficult, but the major issue is limitations galore. Basically get this product is you don't want to know anything or control anything in your network. If you want to do anything or control anything on your network, this is not the product for you. When in mesh mode you MUST use a NAT, you have no choice. If you already have a network setup and are just looking to add Wifi, you will not be able to connect to devices on your wifi. Thanks google!
customer_reviews.author: VinceT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product - I now own 6 Units.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Google Wifi Mesh. I purchased a set of three to help improve the wifi in my home. My home is only 1500 sf so I now have super wifi everywhere. I liked this so much I purchased a set for my warehouse. I was having problems with my rings not staying connected. I tried the little ring chime wifi extenders, but they did basically nothing. I set three of the google wifi mesh in my 8000 sf warehouse and all three of my exterior rings now connect perfectly all the time. I highly suggest the google mesh, awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: The Youtz

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I installed Comcast blast but the IT ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I installed Comcast blast but the IT told me that my modern is old and I couldn't get as much as the speed I purchased and the signal didn't far enough to my entrance. He suggested me to replace a newer modern. One of my friends suggested me to buy the Google Wifi. It works amazingly. I could get the exact speed I purchased and the wifi signal is strong enough to my garage and front entrance. I am so happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Do not use Google WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Don’t use this system. It has started showing a glitch in reporting the speeds compared to other apps. I worked with Google tech support and they agreed the speeds were being reported incorrectly. They said they would rectify immediately. Still holding my breathe. Use another router and save some money and heartache.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Great Wifi Router
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Google WiFi router -- and I have to say -- I'm thoroughly impressed with the range and strength of signal compared to both the ATT modem/router or the Linksys router that I had. I was skeptical, but it's night and day. Easy enough to setup using the app. If you're into more advanced features, this router may not be for you. Will probably add a second one near the rear of my house so that I can get decent coverage outside as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Deleon

customer_reviews.title: Google not comply
customer_reviews.text: Not works without the apps google WiFi. Google home not valid to control it. The problem is the apps is not available to many countries including Chile. I buy it with delivery to my home at Chile. Therefore this device was a complete lose. Why Google is so special to deny to Chilean people this apps without any reason?. We are not enough to Google to receive the service but they had no problem to take our money.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Muller

customer_reviews.title: Best Wi-Fi I have owned
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint would be I wish I had more access to the logs outside of the provided app. That said, there are some APIs and calls I am still working with. Phenomenal Wi-fi and no dead spots any where in my house. I can turn off any of my kids internet with a push of button... iPad, iPhone, iPod, PC... whatever you want to tag them as. It's very modern and very worth it IMO. I have struggled in the past even with repeaters to make wifi seamless and this just fixes everything. Anywhere in my house there is one network with full signal. (I got the three pack)
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Schulze

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up.  Regular  security updates.
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry that I didn't order this sooner! I have needed a new router as mine was quite old, but I was concerned about how difficult it would be to set up. (I remember the tech from Radio Shack setting up my original WiFi router years ago... a bit of a nightmare!) Setting up this router is easier than making scrambled eggs and toast! Seriously... less than ten minutes from start to finish. The Google WiFi app does all of the work for you. The WiFi is strong throughout my two bedroom area with just one unit. If you are nervous about setting up a WiFi router, this one is worth your time!
customer_reviews.author: KSH

customer_reviews.title: Works greats with Google WiFi app and has a nice design
customer_reviews.text: I like that it works great compared to what it replaced. Also great is the ability to use the app so you can change the name and password. I don’t like that it forces you to have a Google account and get their app to control it, but there are worse problems to have and it doesn’t hurt my rating
customer_reviews.author: TokyoEric

customer_reviews.title: Can't be trusted
customer_reviews.text: Setup is 100% tied to a Google account, which sucks big time - delegating full Owner access is therefore impossible. When Comcast service went down, the Google Wifi went stupid - it didn't even let me sign in ("The account cannot be used with Google Wifi") and was useless for troubleshooting. I had to hook up my old ASUS router to see what's wrong. Realtime speed/load measurements are bogus. I'm copying a bunch of photos for 5 minutes already, and it's showing laptop as Idle. Internet download speed measurement is consistently 10 times lower than true download speed (fast.com or speedtest.net). I like the small size of the units though, and the scheduled offline times for devices + parental filtering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Google WiFi System, 1-Pack - Router Replacement for Whole Home Coverage - NLS-1304-25,white
product_meta.description: Size:1-Pack| Style:SingleEnjoy a fast signal in every room, on every device. Google Wi-Fi is a new type of connected system that replaces your router for seamless coverage throughout your home. It is a standalone whole home mesh system which does not promise compatibility or interoperability with other 3rd party Wifi systems. But compatible with all Wifi client devices.
feature_bullets: A new type of connected system that replaces your router for seamless wifi coverage throughout your home, helping eliminate dead zones and buffering
Network assist technology keeps your connection fast by always selecting the clearest channel and fastest band for your devices; WiFi throughput: 1200 MPBS.
A simple app gets you set up quickly and allows you to see what's connected, prioritize devices, and pause the WiFi on kids' devices
A single WiFi point covers up to 1,500 square feet, a set of three covers homes up to 4,500 square feet WiFi points work together so you can add more if you need additional coverage
24/7 phone support from google; 1 year warranty; material: plastic

specifications.Wireless Type: 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars12,061 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
